div.h1: Resources from the School Counseling Department

p.strong: Counseling Resources for East Granby Families

div.p: If you are in crisis dial:

p.span: - if someone needs to go to the hospital or for any other medical emergency including an overdose
mobile crisis person will talk to you & come to you, if necessary, to assess the person & assist with next steps.

p.strong: TEXT 741741 - text any message. A crisis worker will respond including giving resources

p.span: Crisis intervention/suicide prevention Lifeline for students thinking about
995 Day Hill Road Windsor Also in Manchester & many other towns
877 884-3571 Access to comprehensive services for all ages, 1:1, family; includes in- home

-short-term, family therapy in your home or community. We help strengthen relationships between your family members, and improve communication and problem solving skills. Focuses on real solutions unique to the needs of your family. Offers lasting change for families who can’t reach results with traditional family therapies- from significant decreases in violent behavior to reduced high-risk behavior of siblings. -Developing family communication and supportiveness • Improving school performance and behavior in the home • Decreasing negative feelings and reducing blame • Understanding the importance of respecting all family members • Making positive changes and promoting effective solutions
(licensed social worker) – Recommended by an EG family
experience: clinical director for a Partial Hospitalization Program, acute hospitals / emergency departments, intensive in-home therapy, professor at local colleges.
1 Grist Mill Rd, Suite 2C, Simsbury & 304 Main St. Suite B, Farmington
Healing Solutions LLC Ann Haydu, LCSW
Practicing since 1969. 1:1 couples families, children adolescents adults. Marriage & Family Therapy, parenting, anxiety, depression, ADHD.
Growing Potential Services: Therapeutic & Behavioral Solutions

Ages 3-18 Social skills assessments, 1:1, groups, incl. individualized to meet each student’s needs (students must not have aggressive behavior)

). Anxiety, depression, substance abuse, etc. are often symptoms for TRAUMA. Emotional Regulation, Support Group, Children’s Groups.
- recommended by a local emergency mobile crisis counselor

div.p: Hayes Art Therapy – online therapy - recommended by a local therapist

p.span: Classes. create an open environment for the discussion, sale, and creation of the varieties of sequential storytelling including comic books, strips, graphic novels, animation, manga, editorial cartoons, web-comics and its other forms.

div.p: Lynda Dunlop Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner, APRN – recommended by a local therapist

p.span: over 35 years experience in psychiatric services and geriatric medicine. I specialize working with adults from the age of 18 years forward, with diagnosis of PTSD, anxiety, depression, bipolar disorder and ADHD. Office hours include Saturdays and early evenings.
Alternatives to Prescriptions for Emotional / Behavioral / Cognitive Challenges as well as for physical illness
aturopathic Doctor) - Presented to the NCCCollab
123 Dwight Rd. Longmeadow, MA (also in Hamden, CT)
ND 25 years in practice - recommended by an EG family
The Women & Children's Natural Health Center (she sees husbands & Dads too)
998 Farmington Avenue Suite 200, West Hartford, CT 06107

div.p: Scott L. Gourson LLC, Licensed Professional Counselor, Licensed Alcohol & Drug Counselor, Certified Co-Occurring Disorders Professional (Dual Diagnosis Specialist), certification in Addiction Counseling.

p.span: 20+ years in addictions for substances, gambling, food, etc., 1:1 families, groups
Counseling is in person, via telephone or Skype
TEENS 13-19 IN RECOVERY FROM ALCOHOL / SUBSTANCE ADDICTION
Weekly mountain bike rides with experienced biker leaders who have long term recovery. Bikes, lunch provided. No experience needed.
Next ride May 14, 2017, then every Sunday thru October.

div.p: Teen Challenge (adults also) 15 months residential program, New Haven 250 centers in US

p.span: Make good decisions - today's decisions directly affect tomorrow
Any substance use. 6 month program. aSees clients for the 1
3 months in the office, the last 3 months at home or anywhere in the community. Teaches skills.
NA By young addicts, For young addicts
256 Main St Suite E E. Windsor

Psycho sexual evaluations & treatment for male sexual abuse offenders age 12+, including those who have been victims as well. He can refer males whose only issue is victimization, and females to other practitioners.
You may find other providers on CATSO.org – CT Association for the Treatment of Sexual Offenders.

div.p: Mary's Place, A Center for Grieving Children & Families (supported by the Carmon family funeral homes),

p.span: Non-profit organization, provides a safe place in which children, teens and families who are grieving a death share their experiences, receive support and find comfort
Not therapeutic. Currently there are free teen

for those grieving for a sibling, parent, or friend. Call Lisa for an application. There is also a young widows group, a Begin Again adults group for those experiencing any loss, a resource center & library. Recommended
: Fire In My Heart, Ice In My Veins.
Lisa Peluso R.N. (available summers also) 6 Poquonock Ave., Windsor, CT 06095, (860) 688-9621
has information on grief and recommended books
an interfaith service, is held yearly near Memorial Day for families to formally remember a family member. This was created by Carmon Community Funeral Homes in partnership with Mary's Place.
a new (2010) partnership with the Carmon family funeral homes
currently for those grieving the death of a spouse or parent. Educational programs. Individual, couple, or family
, including for grief, is on a sliding fee scale starting at $55/hour.
Debbi Knox, MS, MFT, Certified Grief Recovery Specialist and Family Therapist.

Helps grieving children and teenagers learn healing and coping strategies, as well as creative communication, that help validate their emotions and guide them toward transforming their unresolved grief. 22 week Family Program:

family with children of any age attends group led by a professional to grieve a death in the immediate family. Butterfly release, visit funeral home, other activities. No charge, but donations requested.
Valerie Cordiano, licensed MFT (Marriage and Family Therapist), director for 13 years
is year round, $90 / hour. She does not take insurance.
www.CoveCT.org (203) 634 0500 (There are also COVE's in Meriden, Guilford & New Haven)

It's best to talk about the death and grief, even though it goes against parents’ intuition when a child seems "fine", otherwise the child will likely have outbursts and extreme behavior. Grief is safer if we talk about it. Express your opinion to your child and review what you child may or may not know about grief
Thoughts of grief may surface again years later.
For parents of elementary and middle school students she recommends the
For parents of teens she recommends The Dougy Center,
(Another resource is books by Alan Wolfelt for grieving teens.)

div.p: Your place of worship is also likely another great resource.
